snippet: With Congress polarized ahead of the fall elections, Republicans agreed to a spending deal to keep from being blamed for shutting down the government.
abstract: Editorial expresses relief that House and Senate leaders have reached a budget compromise that will keep the government running through March 2013; offers Republicans, with Congress polarized ahead of the fall elections, only agreed to deal to keep from being blamed for shutting down the government.
lead_paragraph: With Congress polarized ahead of the fall elections, Republicans agreed to a spending deal to keep from being blamed for shutting down the government.

headline.seo: After Budget Deal, No Government Shutdown This Year
headline.main: A Budget Crisis Averted, for Now
headline.print_headline: A Budget Crisis Averted, for Now
